paper_abstract:
Vulnerability of state-of-the-art deep neural networks to adversarial attacks
has been attracting a lot of attention recently. In this work we propose a new
algorithm for constructing universal adversarial perturbations. Our approach is
based on computing the so called $(p, q)$-singular vectors of the Jacobian
matrices of hidden layers of a network. Resulting perturbations present
interesting visual patterns and by using a batch of just $64$ images we can
construct adversarial perturbations with relatively high fooling rate. We also
investigate a correlation between the singular values of the Jacobian matrices
and the fooling rate of a corresponding singular vector.
paper_title: Art of singular vectors and universal adversarial perturbations
